data.name: Weedle
data.flavorText: It eats its weight in leaves every day. It fends off attackers with the needle on its head.

attacks.name: Triple Stab
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Kakuna
data.flavorText: While awaiting evolution, it hides from predators under leaves and in nooks of branches.

attacks.name: Hide
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Beedrill
data.flavorText: Its best attack involves flying around at high speed, striking with poison needles, then flying off.

attacks.name: Swift Sting
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has full HP, this attack does 40 more damage, and the Defending Pokémon is now Confused and Poisoned.

data.name: Exeggcute
data.flavorText: Its six eggs converse using telepathy. They can quickly gather if they become separated.

abilities.name: Propagation
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon is in your discard pile, you may put this Pokémon into your hand.

data.name: Exeggutor
data.flavorText: It is called "The Walking Jungle." If a head grows too big, it falls off and becomes an Exeggcute.

attacks.name: Blockade
attacks.text: Your opponent can't play any Supporter cards from his or her hand during his or her next turn.

attacks.name: Stomp
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.name: Grovyle
data.flavorText: It lives in dense jungles. While closing in on its prey, it leaps from branch to branch.

data.name: Treecko
data.flavorText: The soles of its feet are covered by countless tiny spikes, enabling it to walk on walls and ceilings.

attacks.name: Reckless Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

data.name: Cacturne
data.flavorText: It becomes active at night, seeking prey that is exhausted from the day's desert heat.

attacks.name: Rapid-Fire Needles
attacks.text: Does 30 damage to 1 of your Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Payback
attacks.text: If your opponent has only 1 Prize card left, this attack does 60 more damage and discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Sceptile
data.flavorText: The leaves that grow on its arms can slice down thick trees. It is without peer in jungle combat.

attacks.name: X-Scissor
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 more damage.

attacks.name: Energy Bloom
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from each of your Pokémon that has any Energy attached to it.

data.name: Cacnea
data.flavorText: By storing water in its body, this desert dweller can survive for 30 days without water.

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Leafeon
data.flavorText: With cells similar to those of plants, it performs photosynthesis inside its body and creates pure air.

attacks.name: Energy Crush
attacks.text: Does 20 damage times the amount of Energy attached to all of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Leaf Blade
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.name: Heatran-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Heat Boiler
attacks.text: If this Pokémon is affected by a Special Condition, this attack does 60 more damage.

attacks.name: Dynamite Press
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any Plasma Energy attached to it, this attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Flareon
data.flavorText: Inhaled air is carried to its flame sac, heated, and exhaled as fire that reaches over 3,000 degrees F.

attacks.name: Vengeance
attacks.text: Does 10 more damage for each Pokémon in your discard pile.

attacks.name: Heat Tackle
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

data.name: Litwick
data.flavorText: Its flame is usually out, but it starts shining when it absorbs life force from people or Pokémon.

attacks.name: Singe
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

data.name: Lampent
data.flavorText: The spirits it absorbs fuel its baleful fire. It hangs around hospitals waiting for people to pass on.

attacks.name: Searing Flame
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

data.name: Reshiram
data.flavorText: This legendary Pokémon can scorch the world with fire. It helps those who want to build a world of truth.

attacks.name: Purifying Flame
attacks.text: Remove all Special Conditions from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Fusion Flare
attacks.text: If Zekrom is on your Bench, this attack does 40 more damage.

data.name: Chandelure
data.flavorText: The spirits burned up in its ominous flame lose their way and wander this world forever.

abilities.name: Flare Navigate
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for a Fire Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Pokémon. If you do, put 1 damage counter on that Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Absorb Life
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Horsea
data.flavorText: It makes its nest in the shade of corals. If it senses danger, it spits murky ink and flees.

attacks.name: Fin Smack
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Seadra
data.flavorText: Its spines provide protection. Its fins and bones are prized as traditional-medicine ingredients.

attacks.name: Smokescreen
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

data.name: Wooper
data.flavorText: When walking on land, it covers its body with a poisonous film that keeps its skin from dehydrating.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Quagsire
data.flavorText: It has an easygoing nature. It doesn't care if it bumps its head on boats and boulders while swimming.

abilities.name: Laid-Back
abilities.text: Any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Mud Gun
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any Fighting Energy attached to it, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.name: Vaporeon
data.flavorText: Its cell composition is similar to water molecules. As a result, it can't be seen when it melts away into water.

attacks.name: Refreshing Rain
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from each of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Gold Breaker
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is a Pokémon-EX, this attack does 50 more damage.

data.name: Tympole
data.flavorText: By vibrating its cheeks, it emits sound waves imperceptible to humans and warns others of danger.

attacks.name: Surprise Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Glaceon
data.flavorText: It lowers its body heat to freeze its fur. The hairs then become like needles it can fire.

abilities.name: Freeze Zone
abilities.text: The Retreat Cost of each of your Team Plasma Pokémon in play is ColorlessColorless less.

attacks.name: Icy Wind
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Palpitoad
data.flavorText: It lives in the water and on land. It uses its long, sticky tongue to immobilize its opponents.

attacks.name: Suspicious Soundwave
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Seismitoad
data.flavorText: By putting power into its bumps, it creates vibrations and increases the power of its punches.

attacks.name: Seismic Punch
attacks.text: Does 30 damage to each Benched Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Splashing Turn
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Vanillite
data.flavorText: Theoretically, this Pokémon formed from icicles bathed in energy from the morning sun. Their breath is -58° F.

attacks.name: Jump On
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

data.name: Vanillish
data.flavorText: They cool down the surrounding air and create ice particles, which they use to freeze their foes.

attacks.name: Surefire Spin
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If both of them are heads, this attack does 40 more damage.

data.name: Vanilluxe
data.flavorText: Swallowing large amounts of water, they make snow clouds inside their bodies and, when angry, cause violent blizzards.

attacks.name: ChillMAX
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each Energy attached to this Pokémon. This attack does 60 damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Cold Breath
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Cryogonal
data.flavorText: They are composed of ice crystals. They capture prey with chains of ice, freezing the prey at -148° F.

attacks.name: Call Sign
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Water Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Cryofreeze
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon. The Defending Pokémon can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Kyurem
data.flavorText: This legendary ice Pokémon waits for a hero to fill in the missing parts of its body with truth or ideals.

attacks.name: Frost Spear
attacks.text: Does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Blizzard Burn
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't attack during your next turn.

data.name: Voltorb
data.flavorText: It looks just like a Poké Ball. It is dangerous because it may electrocute or explode on touch.

data.name: Jolteon
data.flavorText: By storing electricity in its body, it can shoot its bristlelike fur like a barrage of missiles.

attacks.name: Pin Missile
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Electri-Defuse
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is a Pokémon-EX, that Pokémon can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Chinchou
data.flavorText: It discharges positive and negative electricity from its antenna tips to shock its foes.

data.name: Electrode
data.flavorText: It is known to drift on winds if it is bloated to bursting with stored electricity.

abilities.name: Magnetic Draw
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may draw cards until you have 4 cards in your hand.

data.name: Pachirisu
data.flavorText: A pair may be seen rubbing their cheek pouches together in an effort to share stored electricity.

attacks.name: Minor Errand-Running
attacks.text: Search your deck for 2 basic Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Electric Tail
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Lanturn
data.flavorText: Lanturn's light can shine up from great depths. It is nicknamed "The Deep-Sea Star."

attacks.name: Special Tackle
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any Special Energy attached to it, this attack does 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Extreme Current
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Zekrom
data.flavorText: This legendary Pokémon can scorch the world with lightning. It assists those who want to build an ideal world.

attacks.name: Mach Claw
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

attacks.name: Fusion Bolt
attacks.text: If Reshiram is on your Bench, this attack does 40 more damage.

data.name: Thundurus-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Raiden Knuckle
attacks.text: Attach an Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Team Plasma Pokémon.

attacks.name: Thunderous Noise
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any Plasma Energy attached to it, discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Nidorina
data.flavorText: When it senses danger, it raises all the barbs on its body. These barbs grow slower than Nidorino's.

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Double Kick
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Nidoran ♀
data.flavorText: While it does not prefer to fight, even one drop of the poison it secretes from its barbs can be fatal.

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Nidoran ♂
data.flavorText: It scans its surroundings by raising its ears out of the grass. Its toxic horn is for protection.

attacks.name: Hit Back
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has no damage counters on it, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Nidoqueen
data.flavorText: Its entire body is armored with hard scales. It will protect the young in its burrow with its life.

attacks.name: Double Stomp
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 more damage for each heads.

data.name: Muk
data.flavorText: It's so stinky! Muk's body contains toxic elements, and any plant will wilt when it passes by.

attacks.name: Poison Suction
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Poisoned, heal 60 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sludge Crash
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Nidorino
data.flavorText: It has a violent disposition and stabs foes with its horn, which oozes poison upon impact.

attacks.name: Double Kick
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Grimer
data.flavorText: Born from sludge, these Pokémon now gather in polluted places and increase the bacteria in their bodies.

attacks.name: Lure Poison
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with the Defending Pokémon. The new Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Sableye
data.flavorText: It hides in the darkness of caves. Its diet of gems has transformed its eyes into gemstones.

attacks.name: Shadow Cage
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Mr. Mime
data.flavorText: It shapes an invisible wall in midair by minutely vibrating its fingertips to stop molecules in the air.

abilities.name: Bench Barrier
abilities.text: Prevent all damage done to your Benched Pokémon by attacks.

attacks.name: Psy Bolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Espeon
data.flavorText: Its fur is so sensitive, it can feel minute shifts in the air and predict the weather…and its foes' thoughts.

attacks.name: Psy Alert
attacks.text: Draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand.

attacks.name: Shadow Ball
attacks.text: This attack does 40 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. Also apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Beldum
data.flavorText: Its cells are all magnetic, and it communicates with others by using magnetic pulses.

attacks.name: Calculate
attacks.text: Look at the top 4 cards of your deck and put them back on top of your deck in any order.

data.name: Metang
data.flavorText: It is formed by two Beldum joining together. Its two brains are linked, amplifying its psychic power.

attacks.name: Psy Bolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Metagross
data.flavorText: With four linked brains, it's more intelligent than a supercomputer, and it uses calculations to analyze foes.

abilities.name: Plasma Search
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for a Team Plasma card, reveal it, and put it in your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward. You may not use an Ability with the same name during your turn.

attacks.name: Mind Bend
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Deoxys-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Power Connect
abilities.text: Your Team Plasma Pokémon's attacks (excluding Deoxys-EX) do 10 more damage to the Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Helix Force
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any Plasma Energy attached to it, this attack does 30 more damage for each Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Cofagrigus
data.flavorText: Grave robbers who mistake them for real coffins and get too close end up trapped inside their bodies.

abilities.name: Six Feet Under
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack) you may Knock Out this Pokémon. If you do, put 3 damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Slap of Misfortune
attacks.text: Whenever your opponent flips a coin during his or her next turn, treat it as tails.

data.name: Cofagrigus
data.flavorText: Grave robbers who mistake them for real coffins and get too close end up trapped inside their bodies.

attacks.name: Elongating Arms
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Crazy Slap
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Yamask
data.flavorText: These Pokémon arose from the spirits of people interred in graves. Each retains memories of its former life.

attacks.name: Transfer Pain
attacks.text: Move 1 damage counter from any of your Pokémon to any of your opponent's Pokémon.

data.name: Yamask
data.flavorText: These Pokémon arose from the spirits of people interred in graves. Each retains memories of its former life.

data.name: Nidoking
data.flavorText: One swing of its mighty tail can snap a telephone pole as if it were a matchstick.

attacks.name: Lovestrike
attacks.text: Does 40 more damage for each Nidoqueen on your Bench.

data.name: Mankey
data.flavorText: It lives in treetop colonies. If one becomes enraged, the whole colony rampages for no reason.

data.name: Primeape
data.flavorText: It grows angry if you see its eyes and gets angrier if you run. If you beat it, it gets even madder.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Karate Chop
attacks.text: Does 80 damage minus 10 damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

data.name: Onix
data.flavorText: Opening its large mouth, it ingests massive amounts of soil and creates long tunnels.

attacks.name: Swing Around
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 60 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Makuhita
data.flavorText: It toughens its body by slamming into thick trees. Many snapped trees can be found near its nest.

attacks.name: Continuous Slap
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Hariyama
data.flavorText: It loves to match power with big-bodied Pokémon. It can knock a truck flying with its arm thrusts.

attacks.name: Fake Out
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Pivot Throw
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is increased by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Umbreon
data.flavorText: When exposed to the moon's aura, the rings on its body glow faintly and it's filled with a mysterious power.

abilities.name: Dark Shade
abilities.text: Each of your Team Plasma Pokémon in play gets +20 HP.

data.name: Sneasel
data.flavorText: A smart and sneaky Pokémon, it makes its opponents flinch by suddenly showing the claws hidden in its paws.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.name: Weavile
data.flavorText: They communicate by clawing signs in boulders and work together to surround enemies.

attacks.name: Hail
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Vilify
attacks.text: Discard as many Pokémon as you like from your hand. This attack does 30 damage times the number of Pokémon you discarded.

data.name: Absol
data.flavorText: It appears from deep in the mountains to warn people about upcoming disasters it has sensed with its horn.

attacks.name: Mind Jack
attacks.text: Does 20 more damage for each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Fearsome Shadow
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals his or her hand.

data.name: Pawniard
data.flavorText: Ignoring their injuries, groups attack by sinking the blades that cover their bodies into their prey.

data.name: Sandile
data.flavorText: They live hidden under hot desert sands in order to keep their body temperature from dropping.

attacks.name: Gentle Slap
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.name: Krokorok
data.flavorText: Protected by thin membranes, their eyes can see even in the dead of night. They live in groups of a few individuals.

data.name: Krookodile
data.flavorText: Very violent Pokémon, they try to clamp down on anything that moves in front of their eyes.

attacks.name: Piston Headbutt
attacks.text: Move an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Pawniard
data.flavorText: Ignoring their injuries, groups attack by sinking the blades that cover their bodies into their prey.

data.name: Bisharp
data.flavorText: This pitiless Pokémon commands a group of Pawniard to hound prey into immobility. It then moves in to finish the prey off.

attacks.name: Dragon Slayer
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is a Dragon Pokémon, this attack does 40 more damage.

data.name: Bisharp
data.flavorText: This pitiless Pokémon commands a group of Pawniard to hound prey into immobility. It then moves in to finish the prey off.

attacks.name: Cut Down
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Deino
data.flavorText: Lacking sight, it's unaware of its surroundings, so it bumps into things and eats anything that moves.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Deino
data.flavorText: Lacking sight, it's unaware of its surroundings, so it bumps into things and eats anything that moves.

attacks.name: Push Down
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Zweilous
data.flavorText: The two heads do not get along. Whichever head eats more than the other gets to be the leader.

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Hydreigon
data.flavorText: It responds to movement by attacking. This scary, three-headed Pokémon devours everything in its path!

attacks.name: Tractorbeam
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with the Defending Pokémon. This attack does 40 damage to the new Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Obsidian Fang
attacks.text: Before doing damage, discard all Pokémon Tool cards attached to the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Steelix
data.flavorText: The iron it ingested with the soil it swallowed transformed its body and made it harder than diamonds.

attacks.name: Metal Defender
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon has no Weakness.

data.name: Mawile
data.flavorText: Attached to its head is a huge set of jaws formed by horns. It can chew through iron beams.

attacks.name: Astonish
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose a random card from your opponent's hand. Your opponent reveals that card and shuffles it into his or her deck.

attacks.name: Big Ol' Bite
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon. The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Dratini
data.flavorText: It is called the "Mirage Pokémon" because so few have seen it. Its shed skin has been found.

attacks.name: Shed Skin
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Dragonair
data.flavorText: If its body takes on an aura, the weather changes instantly. It is said to live in seas and lakes.

attacks.name: Wrap
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Dragonite
data.flavorText: It is said to make its home somewhere in the sea. It guides crews of shipwrecks to shore.

attacks.name: Deafen
attacks.text: Your opponent can't play any Item cards from his or her hand during his or her next turn.

attacks.name: Healwing
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Kingdra
data.flavorText: It lives in caves on the seafloor and creates giant whirlpools every time it moves.

attacks.name: Dragon Vortex
attacks.text: Does 20 damage times the number of Water Energy cards and Lightning Energy cards in your discard pile. Then, shuffle all of those cards back into your deck.

attacks.name: Tri Bullet
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 3 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Latias-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Bright Down
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon by your opponent's Pokémon with Abilities.

attacks.name: Barrier Break
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Latios-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Mach Flight
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Luster Purge
attacks.text: Discard all Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Rattata
data.flavorText: It searches for food all day. It gnaws on hard objects to wear down its fangs, which grow constantly during its lifetime.

attacks.name: Lunge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Raticate
data.flavorText: With its long fangs, this surprisingly violent Pokémon can gnaw away even thick concrete with ease.

attacks.name: Transfer Junk
attacks.text: Put a Team Plasma Pokémon, a Team Plasma Trainer card, and a Team Plasma Energy card from your discard pile into your hand.

data.name: Eevee
data.flavorText: Thanks to its unstable genetic makeup, this special Pokémon conceals many different possible evolutions.

attacks.name: Signs of Evolution
attacks.text: Search your deck for 3 Pokémon of different types that evolve from Eevee. Reveal them and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Eevee
data.flavorText: Thanks to its unstable genetic makeup, this special Pokémon conceals many different possible evolutions.

attacks.name: Growl
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done by attacks from the Defending Pokémon is reduced by 20 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

data.name: Hoothoot
data.flavorText: It marks time precisely. Some countries consider it to be a wise friend, versed in the world's ways.

attacks.name: Dual Draw
attacks.text: Each player draws 2 cards.

data.name: Noctowl
data.flavorText: Its eyes are specially developed to enable it to see clearly even in murky darkness and minimal light.

attacks.name: Powerful Vision
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the number of cards in your opponent's hand.

attacks.name: Fly
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Miltank
data.flavorText: It is said that kids who drink Miltank's milk grow up to become hearty, healthy adults.

attacks.name: Max Milk
attacks.text: Heal all damage from 1 of your Pokémon. Then, discard all Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Staravia
data.flavorText: Recognizing their own weakness, they always live in a group. When alone, a Staravia cries noisily.

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

data.name: Float Stone
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
The Pokémon this card is attached to has no Retreat Cost.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Kecleon
data.flavorText: It can freely change its body's color. The zigzag pattern on its belly doesn't change, however.

abilities.name: Color Change
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, this Pokémon is the same type as the your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Imittack
attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. If this Pokémon has the necessary Energy to use that attack, use it as this attack.

data.name: Staraptor
data.flavorText: It never stops attacking even if it is injured. It fusses over the shape of its comb.

attacks.name: Strong Breeze
attacks.text: Your opponent shuffles the Defending Pokémon and all cards attached to it into his or her deck.

data.name: Starly
data.flavorText: Because they are weak individually, they form groups. However, they bicker if the group grows too big.

data.name: Tornadus-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Windfall
attacks.text: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw 6 cards.

attacks.name: Jet Blast
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Plasma Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Superior Energy Retrieval
rules: Discard 2 cards from your hand. (If you can't discard 2 cards, you can't play this card.) Put 4 basic Energy cards from your discard pile into your hand. (You can't choose a card you discarded with the effect of this card.)
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Ghetsis
rules: Your opponent reveals his or her hand and shuffles all Item cards found there into his or her deck. Then, draw a number of cards equal to the number of Item cards your opponent shuffled into his or her deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Shadow Triad
rules: Put a Team Plasma card from your discard pile into your hand.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Frozen City
rules: Whenever any player attaches an Energy from his or her hand to 1 of his or her Pokémon (excluding Team Plasma Pokémon) put 2 damage counters on that Pokémon.
This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

data.name: Team Plasma Ball
rules: Search your deck for a Team Plasma Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Plasma Energy
rules: This card provides Colorless Energy.

data.name: Team Plasma Badge
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
The Pokémon this card is attached to is a Team Plasma Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Rock Guard
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
If the Pokémon this card is attached to is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if that Pokémon is Knocked Out), put 6 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).
You can't have more than 1 ACE SPEC card in your deck.

data.name: Life Dew
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
If the Pokémon this card is attached to is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 1 fewer Prize card.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).
You can't have more than 1 ACE SPEC card in your deck.

data.name: Heatran-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Heat Boiler
attacks.text: If this Pokémon is affected by a Special Condition, this attack does 60 more damage.

attacks.name: Dynamite Press
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any Plasma Energy attached to it, this attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Thundurus-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Raiden Knuckle
attacks.text: Attach an Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Team Plasma Pokémon.

attacks.name: Thunderous Noise
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any Plasma Energy attached to it, discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Latias-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Bright Down
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon by your opponent's Pokémon with Abilities.

attacks.name: Barrier Break
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Deoxys-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Power Connect
abilities.text: Your Team Plasma Pokémon's attacks (excluding Deoxys-EX) do 10 more damage to the Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Helix Force
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any Plasma Energy attached to it, this attack does 30 more damage for each Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Latios-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Mach Flight
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Luster Purge
attacks.text: Discard all Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Tornadus-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Windfall
attacks.text: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw 6 cards.

attacks.name: Jet Blast
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Plasma Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Ghetsis
rules: Your opponent reveals his or her hand and shuffles all Item cards found there into his or her deck. Then, draw a number of cards equal to the number of Item cards your opponent shuffled into his or her deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Professor Juniper
rules: Discard your hand and draw 7 cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Empoleon
data.flavorText: This extremely rare Pokémon is a different color than usual. It is very hard to find.

abilities.name: Diving Draw
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard 1 card from your hand. Then, draw 2 cards.

attacks.name: Attack Command
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the number of Pokémon in play (both yours and your opponent's).

data.name: Garbodor
data.flavorText: This extremely rare Pokémon is a different color than usual. It is very hard to find.

abilities.name: Garbotoxin
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has a Pokémon Tool card attached to it, each Pokémon in play, in each player's hand, and in each player's discard pile has no Abilities (except for Garbotoxin).

data.name: Garchomp
data.flavorText: This extremely rare Pokémon is a different color than usual. It is very hard to find.

attacks.name: Mach Cut
attacks.text: Discard a Special Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dragonblade
attacks.text: Discard the top 2 cards of your deck.

data.name: Sigilyph
data.flavorText: This extremely rare Pokémon is a different color than usual. It is very hard to find.

abilities.name: Safeguard
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon by Pokémon-EX.

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.text: Does 10 more damage for each Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Max Potion
rules: Heal all damage from 1 of your Pokémon. Then, discard all Energy attached to that Pokémon.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Ultra Ball
rules: Discard 2 cards from your hand. (If you can't discard 2 cards, you can't play this card.) Search your deck for a Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).
